title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
South west France surf beaches
The place to be ! üåü

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
Some (üò®) numbers






Castelle et al. (2019)






One of the most dangerous coasts in the world (Castelle et al. 2019) : heavy rip current (Ba√Ønes), shore break




Surveillance mainly during summer : Thousands of rescues each year




 20 to 30 fatal drownings each year  (üí™ 0 between the flags)




About \(1\over2\) of swimmers bathe outside of the surveillance zone (Dehez and Lyser 2021)

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
Previous work in France




Physical modelling of hazard for South-west France : (Castelle et al. 2019)














Drowning risk prediction using Log. Regression (Tellier et al. 2021)
Based on emergency calls database
Probability of a drowning occuring each day, based on weather, oceanic and crowd data

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
Goal of this work

Same philosophy as (Tellier et al. 2021) : Daily prediction based on weather and beach crowd
Better (and cleaner) data
New statistical methods üåü

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text: New statistical methods üåü

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
Machine learning ü§ñ in a nutshell

















AI == ML == statistics & IFELSES

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
What‚Äôs a risk ?

Our definition :








Hazard : Is it dangerous ?
Exposure : Is the beach crowded ?

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
The predictors




Hazard (daily maximum)



Wave incidence factor : \({cos}_4H = cos((278 - D\_{SWELL}) \times \frac{\pi}{180})^4\)
Wave factor : \(HsTp = H_{SWELL} \times P_{SWELL}\)









Exposure



\(T_{air}\) : air temperature in ¬∞C (3-day pred. & daily max value)
\(day\) : day (ex : \(6\) for \(6^{th}\) of July)
\(month\) : month (ex : \(7\) for July)
\(wday\) : weekday (ex : \(1\) for monday)

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
The outcome

Water inhalation & respiratory impairements (leads to emergency calls)
Emergency calls database from 2011 to 2022 | N = 522
Binary daily data (a drowning occured / no drowning occured)

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
Our challengers











Logistic regression : No tuning parameters



Classical regression for binary outcome
Used in previous work (Tellier et al. 2021)















Random Forests : 3 tuning parameters



# of trees
# of random variables
minimum tree depth















XGBoost : 4 tuning parameters



same as RF
learning rate
spoiler: üèÜ

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
Modelling strategy




About these steps


Pre-processing

Centering, scaling, dummy-coding
Synthetic Minority over-Sampling Technique (SMOTE) (Chawla et al. 2002) for the outcome
removing correlations (\(r > 0.9\))

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
Modelling strategy




About these steps



Tuning grid generated by Latin Hypercube Sampling (Sacks et al. 1989)

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text: Modelling strategy

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text: Tuning workflow results

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
I have bad news‚Ä¶

Daily drownings events can‚Äôt be predicted with 100% precision.

The probability output by the model is discretized using 5 classes :

title: Using machine learning to predict drownings in surf beaches of southwest France
text:
Discussion


What is the best drowning prediction model ? Should we prioritize lowering false negatives or false positives ? \(\rightarrow\) Risk management and political decisions




Low improvements over previous models \(\rightarrow\) dataset limitation ?






Emergency call database only covers a minority(üò±) of all rescues

References




D. Carayon et al.¬†2023 | Predicting drownings using machine learning




Castelle, Bruno, Tim Scott, Rob Brander, Jak McCarroll, Arthur Robinet, Eric Tellier, Elias de Korte, Bruno Simonnet, and Louis-Rachid Salmi. 2019. ‚ÄúEnvironmental Controls on Surf Zone Injuries on High-Energy Beaches.‚Äù Natural Hazards and Earth System Sciences 19 (10): 21832205.


Chawla, N. V., K. W. Bowyer, L. O. Hall, and W. P. Kegelmeyer. 2002. ‚ÄúSMOTE: Synthetic Minority over-Sampling Technique.‚Äù Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research 16 (June): 321‚Äì57. https://doi.org/10.1613/jair.953.


Dehez, Jeoffrey, and Sandrine Lyser. 2021. ‚ÄúFr√©quentation des plages oc√©anes et risques de baignade en Aquitaine en 2020. Une √©tude exploratoire.‚Äù Research Report. INRAE. https://hal.science/hal-03549020.


Sacks, Jerome, William J. Welch, Toby J. Mitchell, and Henry P. Wynn. 1989. ‚ÄúDesign and Analysis of Computer Experiments.‚Äù Statistical Science 4 (4). https://doi.org/10.1214/ss/1177012413.


Tellier, √âric, Bruno Simonnet, C√©dric Gil-Jardin√©, Marion Lerouge-Bailhache, Bruno Castelle, and Rachid Salmi. 2021. ‚ÄúPredicting Drowning from Sea and Weather Forecasts: Development and Validation of a Model on Surf Beaches of Southwestern France.‚Äù Injury Prevention 28 (1): 16‚Äì22. https://doi.org/10.1136/injuryprev-2020-044092.

title: SK8 - Gestion et h√©bergement d‚Äôapplications R Shiny sur des infrastructures INRAE
text:
Shiny, c‚Äôest quoi ? ü§î

















Shiny est un package R qui permet de d√©velopper facilement des applications web interactives dans une syntaxe R tr√®s simple (pouvant √™tre compl√©t√©e par du HTML / CSS / JS pour les applications les plus abouties).
Outil principalement utilis√© pour l‚Äôanalyse et la visualisation de donn√©es (mais pas que)

title: SK8 - Gestion et h√©bergement d‚Äôapplications R Shiny sur des infrastructures INRAE
text:
Un exemple



CI-TIQUE Tracker

title: SK8 - Gestion et h√©bergement d‚Äôapplications R Shiny sur des infrastructures INRAE
text:
Quelques notions n√©cessaires
Continuous Integration / Continuous Development (CI/CD)








Suite d‚Äôinstructions automatiques lors de mise √† jour de code
Permet d‚Äôappliquer des tests automatiques (s√©curit√©) ou encore d‚Äôeffectuer des actions (publication de donn√©es, pages web, etc.)
Pilot√© par exemple par un fichier .gitlab-ci.yml




gitlab-ci.yml

01-Publier:
  stage: G√©rer mon application
  needs: ["Construire-l-application"]
  image: curlimages/curl:latest
  rules:
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == $CI_DEFAULT_BRANCH && $MISE_A_JOUR_AUTOMATIQUE == "true"'
      when: on_success
      allow_failure: false
    - if: '$CI_COMMIT_BRANCH == $CI_DEFAULT_BRANCH && $MISE_A_JOUR_AUTOMATIQUE == "false"'
      when: manual
      allow_failure: true
  before_script:
    - ACTION=$SK8_DEPLOY
  script:
    - *commande-job

title: SK8 - Gestion et h√©bergement d‚Äôapplications R Shiny sur des infrastructures INRAE
text:
Quelques notions n√©cessaires
Docker




Permet de Containeuriser des logiciels, applications
Cr√©ation d‚Äôune image Docker √† partir d‚Äôune recette : le Dockerfile
Facilite la diffusion (gestion des d√©pendances syst√®mes, etc.)




Dockerfile

FROM rocker/verse:4.2.1
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y  cmake imagemagick libcurl4-openssl-dev [...]
RUN mkdir -p /usr/local/lib/R/etc/ /usr/lib/R/etc/
RUN echo "options(repos = c(CRAN = 'https://cran.rstudio.com/'), download.file.method = 'libcurl', Ncpus = 4)"
RUN R -e 'install.packages("remotes")'
RUN Rscript -e 'remotes::install_version("magrittr",upgrade="never", version = "2.0.3")'
RUN Rscript -e 'remotes::install_version("htmltools",upgrade="never", version = "0.5.5")'
[...]
RUN Rscript -e 'remotes::install_github("rstudio/sass@2f1f152d84c162ccb9aba1c056e3548079d669d9")'
RUN mkdir /build_zone
ADD . /build_zone
WORKDIR /build_zone
RUN R -e 'remotes::install_local(upgrade="never")'
RUN rm -rf /build_zone
EXPOSE 3838
CMD R -e "options('shiny.port'=3838,shiny.host='0.0.0.0');ShinyIDEA::run_app()"

FROM rocker/verse:4.2.1
